verses.verse: {The Covenant Extended to the Righteous} d For {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX lack For} this is what the Lord says: "Maintain justice, and do what is right, for soon my salvation will come, and soon my deliverance will be revealed.

Blessed is the one who does this, and the person that holds it fast, who observes the Sabbath without profaning it, and restrains his hands {So 1QIsa a LXX 1QIsa b MT read hand} from practicing any evil.

"Let {So 1QIsa a LXX; 1QIsa b MT read And let} no foreigner who has joined himself to the Lord say: «The Lord will surely exclude me from his people.'Furthermore, let no eunuch say, «Look! {So 1QIsa a 1QIsa b MT; LXX lacks Look !} I am just a dry tree.»"
For this is what the Lord says: "To the eunuchs who observe my Sabbaths, who choose the things that please me, and who hold fast my covenant

to them I will give in my house {I. e. God's Temple} and within my walls a monument and a name better than sons and daughters. I will give them {So 1QIsa a LXX; 1QIsa b MT read him} an everlasting name that will not be cut off. {The Heb. verb is a word play on the Heb. word eunuch}

"Also, the foreigners who join themselves to {So 1QIsa a (cf. v 3); 1QIsa b MT read upon} the Lord , to minister to him, to love the name of the Lord , {So 1QIsa b MT LXX; 1QIsa a lacks this line} to be his servants, and to bless the Lord's name, observing {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT LXX read all who observe} the Sabbath without profaning it, and who hold fast my covenant

these I will bring to my holy mountain, and make them joyful in my house of prayer. Their burnt-offerings and their sacrifices will rise up to be accepted {1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b 4QIsa i MT LXX read will be accepted} on my altar; for my house will be called a house of prayer for everyone." {Lit. for all peoples}

{A Rebuke to Israel's Guardians} d This is what the Lord God says, the one who gathers the outcasts of Israel: "I'll gather still others to them besides those already gathered. {Lit. besides their gathered ones}

"All you wild animals, {So 1QIsa a LXX; 1QIsa b MT read Every wild animal} come and devour even {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT LXX lack even} all of you wild animals. {So 1QIsa a LXX; 1QIsa b MT read every wild animal}

His {I. e. Israel's; so 1QIsa a MT q} watchmen {MT reads His watchman ; LXX reads Look! They all} are blind; they are all without knowledge. They are all dumb dogs they cannot bark. They keep on dreaming and lying around, and they're lovers of sleep! {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT reads sleeping}

Meanwhile, {Lit. And} the dogs have a mighty appetite they can never get enough. And as for them, they are the shepherds {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads shepherds ; LXX reads evil} who lack understanding; they have all turned to their own way, each one to his gain, each and every one.

«Come!'they say, «let's {So 1QIsa a MT ms ; 1QIsa b reads I will ; MT reads let me} have some wine, and let's fill ourselves with strong drink! Then, {Or And} tomorrow will be like today, {1QIsa a reads this the day ; 1QIsa b MT read this day} or even much better!»"
